TOC Estimation

toc_estimation.Rd

Estimates the targeting operator characteristic (TOC) induced by the estimated CATEs.

toc_estimation(cates, scores, beneficial = TRUE)

Arguments

cates

Estimated CATEs. Must be out-of-sample predictions on the validation sample.

scores

Estimated doubly-robust scores. Must be estimated via K-fold cross-fitting using the validation sample.

beneficial

Logical, whether the treatment is beneficial to units. If TRUE, units are ranked according to decreasing values of cates, otherwise they are ranked according to increasing values of cates.

Value

A vector of estimated TOCs sorted according to the increasing or decreasing values of cates.

Details

To estimate the TOC induced by the estimated CATEs, the user must provide the estimated CATEs and doubly-robust scores. Be careful, as the CATEs must be estimated only with using the training sample, while the doubly-robust scores must be estimated in the validation sample using K-fold cross fitting (see the example section below).

The TOC is estimated using a sample-averaging estimator. Check the online vignette for details.

See also

blp_estimation, gates_estimation, rate_estimation

Author

Riccardo Di Francesco

Examples

## Generate data.
set.seed(1986)

n <- 1000
k <- 2

X <- matrix(rnorm(n * k), ncol = k)
colnames(X) <- paste0("x", seq_len(k))
D <- rbinom(n, size = 1, prob = 0.5)
mu0 <- 0.5 * X[, 1]
mu1 <- 0.5 * X[, 1] + X[, 2]
Y <- mu0 + D * (mu1 - mu0) + rnorm(n)

## Sample split.
train_idx <- sample(c(TRUE, FALSE), length(Y), replace = TRUE)

X_tr <- X[train_idx, ]
X_val <- X[!train_idx, ]

D_tr <- D[train_idx]
D_val <- D[!train_idx]

Y_tr <- Y[train_idx]
Y_val <- Y[!train_idx]

## CATEs and nuisance functions estimation.
## We use only the training sample for estimation.
## We predict on the validation sample.
library(grf)

cates_forest <- causal_forest(X_tr, Y_tr, D_tr) 
cates_val <- predict(cates_forest, X_val)$predictions 

## AIPW scores estimation.
## Cross-fitting on the validation sample.
library(aggTrees)
scores_val <- dr_scores(Y_val, D_val, X_val)

## TOC estimation. 
toc_results <- toc_estimation(cates_val, scores_val)
